comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: This is very interesting. Theodore Roosevelt was shot by an assassin on 14 October 1910 in Milwaukee for which he was treated in Chicago's Mercy Hospital. A famous incident obviously. Perhpas this is indicating the rooms in which he stayed at the hospital. There are other pics in this flickr set about this, notably this x-ray showing the bullet: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2405647494/ Schrank's revolver: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2405648696/ Schrank: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2404818939/ Part of Schrank's hand written confession: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2404819255/ Elbert Martin with the bullet pierced speech: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2405648996/ A jolly Schrank under arrest: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2405648996/ The upshot is that I'm having trouble understanding why the date Dec. 17, 1910 is appearing in this caption. The adjacent photograph in the set of Mrs. McCormick and Mrs. Longworth walking out the door of the Mercy Hospital appear to corroborate my contention: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2422668923/ Added: This UPI story gives a good round up too: 100years.upi.com/sta_1912-10-15.html

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Lifeasdaddy: We appreciate your help in correcting the date and adding the sources.  It'll take a few weeks, but we've started updating ALL the records you listed in the source catalog. You've made a lot of photo descriptions more useful by linking them to the attempted assassination on TR!!
